org.smtlib.solvers

Class Solver_z3_4_3

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.AbstractSolver
      • org.smtlib.solvers.Solver_z3_4_3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISolver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Solver_z3_2_11

    public class Solver_z3_4_3
extends AbstractSolver
implements ISolver
    This class is an adapter that takes the SMT-LIB ASTs and translates them into Z3 commands

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IResponse assertExpr(IExpr sexpr)
      Asserts the given expression into the solver state (in the top stack frame); the expression is expected to be already checked that it is a valid, well-formed and well-sorted expression in the current logic.
      IResponse check_sat()
      Checks whether the current state is satisfiable in the current logic.
      IResponse checkSatStatus()
      Current check-sat status
      IResponse declare_fun(ICommand.Ideclare_fun cmd)
      Defines a new uninterpreted constant or function

      Declares a new basic sort
      IResponse define_fun(ICommand.Idefine_fun cmd)
      Defines a new function
      IResponse define_sort(ICommand.Idefine_sort cmd)
      Defines a new sort abbreviation
      IResponse exit()
      Terminate the solver; no further commands are permitted.
      IResponse get_assertions()
      Returns a list of all the formulae that have been asserted in the current state.
      IResponse get_assignment()
      Retrieves values for all named formulae in the current (satisfiable) state.
      IResponse get_info(IExpr.IKeyword key)
      Gets the value of an SMT-LIB information topic
      IResponse get_option(IExpr.IKeyword key)
      Gets the value of an SMT-LIB option
      IResponse get_proof()
      Returns a proof that the current state is unsatisfiable.
      IResponse get_unsat_core()
      Returns a list of the names of formulae in the unsat core of the current (unsatisfiable) state.
      IResponse get_value(IExpr... terms)
      Returns a list of values for the given expressions.
      protected IResponse parseResponse(java.lang.String response) 
      IResponse pop(int number)
      Pops the given number of stack frames from the solver state.
      IResponse push(int number)
      Adds the given number of empty stack frames to the solver state.

      Sets an SMT-LIB info value

      Sets the logic the solver should use; the position argument is just used for position information in error messages.

      Sets an SMT-LIB option

      A reference to the SMT configuration

      Starts the solver; this is not an SMT-LIB command, but it is convenient in some implementations to separate the starting and initialization from the construction of the solver instance.

      • get_assertions

        public IResponse get_assertions()
        Description copied from interface: ISolver
        Returns a list of all the formulae that have been asserted in the current state. If the solver prints the list of assertions itself, then this method simply returns success. May only be used in interactive mode. If interactive mode is not implemented, this command may return unsupported.
        Specified by:
        get_assertions in interface ISolver
        Overrides:
        get_assertions in class AbstractSolver
        Returns:
        success or a list of formulae (as Strings or terms?) // TODO is this what we want?
        See Also:
        ISolver.check_sat()

      • get_proof

        public IResponse get_proof()
        Description copied from interface: ISolver
        Returns a proof that the current state is unsatisfiable. If the solver prints the proof itself, then it returns simply success. // TODO check is this what we want May only be issued if the :produce-proofs option is enabled. Supporting proof production is optional.
        Specified by:
        get_proof in interface ISolver
        Overrides:
        get_proof in class AbstractSolver
        Returns:
        error or success or unsupported (if proof production is not supported) or a proof
        See Also:
        ISolver.get_proof()

      • get_unsat_core

        public IResponse get_unsat_core()
        Description copied from interface: ISolver
        Returns a list of the names of formulae in the unsat core of the current (unsatisfiable) state. May only be issued if :produce-unsat-core is enabled.
        Specified by:
        get_unsat_core in interface ISolver
        Overrides:
        get_unsat_core in class AbstractSolver
        Returns:
        unsupported or error or a list of names (as ids)
        See Also:
        ISolver.get_unsat_core()

        Specified by:

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • get_value

        public IResponse get_value(IExpr... terms)
        Description copied from interface: ISolver
        Returns a list of values for the given expressions. May only be used if :produce-models is enabled.
        Specified by:
        get_value in interface ISolver
        Overrides:
        get_value in class AbstractSolver
        Parameters:
        terms - expressions whose value in the current (Satisfiable) state is to be determined
        Returns:
        error or list of values (which may include IError instances)
